Package org.ginsim.core.graph.view.style

Class StyleManager<V,​E extends Edge<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ginsim.core.graph.view.style.StyleManager<V,​E>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of Vertices
    E - The type of Edges
    public class StyleManager<V,​E extends Edge<V>>
extends Object
    Store and handle styles for a Graph.
    Author:
    Aurelien Naldi

      Create a style manager, defining default styles.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StyleManager

        public StyleManager​(Graph<V,​E> g,
                    GraphBackend<V,​E> backend,
                    GraphFactory factory)
        Create a style manager, defining default styles.
        Parameters:
        g - the graph to manage
        backend - the graph backend in which the data is stored
        backend - factory the factory providing the default styles

    • Method Detail

      • isCompatMode

        public boolean isCompatMode()
        Check if the styles are disabled (for backward compatibility when saving).
        Returns:
        true if styles should not be used.

      • getNodeStyle

        public NodeStyle<V> getNodeStyle​(String name)
        Retrieve a node style based on its name. Note that this is not the regular way to retrieve a style, and should only be used by the parser.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        the corresponding style, or null if not found/default

      • getEdgeStyle

        public EdgeStyle<V,​E> getEdgeStyle​(String name)
        Retrieve an edge style based on its name. Note that this is not the regular way to retrieve a style, and should only be used by the parser.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        the corresponding style, or null if not found/default

      • guessNodeStyle

        public NodeStyle guessNodeStyle​(String qName,
                                Attributes attributes)
        Find a node style corresponding to the desired attributes. If needed, a new style will be created. Note that this is not the regular way to retrieve a style, it should only used when parsing old models (without styles) to assign the same style to elements with similar attributes.
        Parameters:
        qName -
        attributes -
        Returns:
        a matching style (can be a new one)

      • guessEdgeStyle

        public EdgeStyle guessEdgeStyle​(String qName,
                                Attributes attributes)
        Find an edge style corresponding to the desired attributes. If needed, a new style will be created. Note that this is not the regular way to retrieve a style, it should only used when parsing old models (without styles) to assign the same style to elements with similar attributes.
        Parameters:
        qName -
        attributes -
        Returns:
        a matching style (can be a new one)

      • getNodeStyles

        public List<NodeStyle<V>> getNodeStyles()

        Returns:
        the list of node styles

      • getViewNodeStyle

        public NodeStyle<V> getViewNodeStyle​(V node)
        Get the node style used for the view. The returned style can be the core one or a style provided by a StyleProvider.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        the style for this node.

      • getUsedNodeStyle

        public NodeStyle<V> getUsedNodeStyle​(V node)
        Get the node style stored in the graph. The returned style ignores the presence of a StyleProvider.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        the style for this node.

        Returns:
        the style for this edge.

      • stylesUpdated

        public void stylesUpdated()
        Called when all styling has been modified, it will refresh the view.

      • styleUpdated

        public void styleUpdated​(Style style)
        Called when a style has been modified, it will refresh the view. Currently it just forwards call to stylesUpdated()
        Parameters:
        style - the updated style

      • setStyleProvider

        public void setStyleProvider​(StyleProvider<V,​E> provider)
        Define the style provider, it will override graph's style until it is removed.
        Parameters:
        provider - the provider to use or null to remove it

      • getStyleProvider

        public StyleProvider getStyleProvider()
        Retrieve the current style provider.
        Returns:
        the style provider (null by default)
